attr.q: I roll a die n times, n \in \mathbb{N}. Find the probability that numbers 1 and 6 are are both observed at least once.
attr.a:
Let \bold{1} be the event that at least one 1 is observed, and \bold{6} that at least one 6 is observed.

\begin{aligned} &1 - P(\bold{1}^c) - P(\bold{6}^c) + P(\bold{1}^c , \bold{6}^c) \\ &= 1 - \left(\frac{5}{6} \right)^n - \left(\frac{5}{6} \right)^n + \left(\frac{4}{6} \right)^n \end{aligned}
